channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside 28 Claremont Road, 29th August
item.description:
The blue and grey wheelie bins outside this property never get emptied by the council. I think this is because all the flats in the house are let on Airbnb and the guests haven't been told how to separate the waste. Please can Brent contact the owner about this! And also empty all 4 bins as it is an eyesore and also an attraction for vermin.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Claremont Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Street cleaning - Grass verges / Shrub beds - Littering

item.title: Blocked drain, 29th August
item.description:
Street drain at corner of Plaistow Lane and Widmore Road (north side) is blocked and flooding.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Widmore Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pathway between William Foster Lane/Station Approach, 29th August
item.description:
This small section of greenery between William Foster Lane and Station Approach, is an absolute eyesore for the amount of abandoned rubbish scattered down in the embankment. Not once has this been attended to in the couple of years that I have lived in Welling. It is littered with an abandoned buggy, book cabinet, cans, bottles, carrier bags and dog waste bags. This issue seriously needs addressing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): William Foster Lane, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin men reversed into telephone pole and like to collapse, 29th August
item.description:

item.title: Public Litter Bins, 29th August
item.description:
Email received by CSC inbox 27/08/25 09:38 • Please give brief details of your complaint or compliment below: Fed up when walking on pavement to contend with ill use of the bins on path , they are there for sweet wrappers small empty take away cartons,not for food waste bags as shown in picture they are. Cramed in but the foxes can rip them open happens in parks where children play anywhere that has any sort of bin on lamppost or pavement.ripped bags opened K have seen nappies plastic bottles all encourage rats if they can’t get the bag in bin it’s left at side seems mentality is well someone will empty bin can take my rubbish as well. Never had this in my youth you get fined if you don’t pick up dog poo need but can leave all sorts of rubbish on pavement • Have you already spoken to somebody in the Council about this matter? no

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beck Way, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
